title: Home Depot stock falls after earnings beat, but outlook implies slowing growth; Profit, total sales and same-store sales extend streaks of beating expectations, gross margin contracts slightly
text:
Read the Home Depot earnings preview.

Total sales grew 5.6% to $38.87 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $37.95 billion, to beat expectations for the 12th-straight quarter.

Overall same-store sales growth of 4.3% topped the FactSet consensus for a 3.1% rise, the fifth-straight beat, and U.S. same-store sales were up 4.5% to beat expectations of 3.0% growth.

"We delivered another solid performance in the third quarter, driven by strength in project-related categories across the business," said Chief Executive Ted Decker.

Cost of sales increased more than total sales, rising 5.7% to $23.65 billion, as gross margin contracted to 34.0% from 34.1%. Merchandise inventories of $25.72 billion were down 1.4% from the end of July but up 25.0% from a year ago.

The stock HD fell 1.4% in premarket trading, making it the only component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA falling ahead of the open.

The company affirmed its fiscal 2022 EPS guidance of growth in the mid-single digits percentage range and for same-store sales growth of 3.0%. The FactSet EPS consensus of $16.60 implies 6.9% growth, and the consensus for same-store sales is for a 3.1% rise.

Wells Fargo analyst Zachary Fadem said that while third-quarter results were "solid across the board," the affirmed full-year outlook implies growth deceleration in the current fourth quarter.

He said that sets "a more realistic bar" for the rest of the year, but also gives credence to the notion that "the environment could be softening."

Fadem reiterated his overweight rating on the stock.

The stock has lost 2.4% over the past three months through Monday, while the SPDR Consumer Discretionary Select Sector exchange-traded fund XLY has dropped 16.5% and the Dow has eased 1.1%.

Home Depot stock falls after earnings beat, but outlook implies slowing growth
